meanings.sent1: I am so stoked for the party tonight!
meanings.sent2: She was stoked to receive an award for her hard work.
meanings.sent3: The kids were stoked to see the clown at the birthday party.
meanings.sent4: His stoked expression lit up the room like a bright light.
meanings.sent5: The crowd's stoked cheers filled the stadium with energy.

meanings.definition: To be filled with excitement or energy.
meanings.sent1: The fans were stoked for the big game.
meanings.sent2: He stoked the fire to keep it burning brightly.
meanings.sent3: The news of the surprise party stoked her excitement even more.
meanings.sent4: Her words stoked a fire of determination within him.
meanings.sent5: The music stoked their energy, making them dance all night.

meanings.definition: To be fully prepared or equipped.
meanings.sent1: She stoked the campfire with plenty of wood for the night.
meanings.sent2: The team stoked up on snacks before the competition.
meanings.sent3: He stoked his backpack with all the necessary supplies for the hike.
meanings.sent4: The chef stoked the kitchen with fresh ingredients for the busy evening.
meanings.sent5: They stoked the car with fuel before embarking on the road trip.
